name: Infoblox DDI
description: This app supports various containment and investigative actions on Infoblox Grid Manager

actions.verbose: Get network information for an IP or IP range (in CIDR notation). If an IP is not provided, return all network ranges.

actions.description: Get the leases for the given IP/domain
actions.verbose: Default value for network_view is 'default'. This action will not fetch system information of a host that has static IP and belongs to a non-default network view.

example_values: Mac address: 0a:10:10:a0:a0:10, Is static ip: True

actions.verbose:
This action uses a multistep approach to unblock the IP:
  • Check if RPZ exists with policy override 'None(GIVEN)'. If not, action will fail.
  • Remove the RPZ rule 'Block IP Address (No Such Domain)' with the specified IP address.
Default value for network_view is 'default'.

This action blocks the IP by creating an appropriate RPZ. It blocks the domain by modifying the response of the DNS recursive query. The domain will not resolve the IP address/network. If all the IP addresses of the domain are blocked, the domain will be blocked. Each RPZ can have various rules associated with it. The response of a recursive query is modified if it matches any of the RPZ rules. The responses are first matched with the RPZ rules, and if there is a match, the rule defined at the RPZ level override is used. The override depends on the order of RPZ. The RPZs are prioritized in ascending order. Ensure that the specified RPZ has policy override 'None(GIVEN)', so that rule defined at RPZ level override is used. This action uses a multistep approach to block the IP:
  • Check if RPZ exists with policy override 'None(GIVEN)'. If not, action will fail.
  • Add the RPZ rule 'Block IP Address (No Such Domain)' with the specified IP address. If another RPZ rule with a specified IP already exists with other than (No Such Domain) policy, the action will fail.
Default value for network_view is 'default'.

This action uses a multistep approach to unblock the domain:
  • Check if RPZ exists with policy override 'None(GIVEN)'. If not, action will fail.
  • Remove the RPZ rule 'Block Domain Name (No Such Domain)' with the specified domain.
Default value for network_view is 'default'.

This action blocks the domain by creating appropriate RPZ. Each RPZ can have various rules associated with it. The response of a recursive query is modified if it matches any of the RPZ rules. The responses are first matched with the RPZ rules, and if there is a match, the rule defined at the RPZ level override is used. The override depends on the order of RPZ. The RPZs are prioritized in ascending order. Ensure that the specified RPZ has policy override 'None(GIVEN)', so that rule defined at RPZ level override is used. This action uses a multistep approach to block the domain:
  • Check if RPZ exists with policy override 'None(GIVEN)'. If not, action will fail.
  • Add the RPZ rule 'Block Domain Name (No Such Domain)' with the specified domain. If another RPZ rule with a specified domain already exists with other than (No Such Domain) policy, the action will fail.
Default value for network_view is 'default'.

actions.description: List details of Response Policy Zones
